alert.note: Alert for Creek; Osage; Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 04 at 11:51PM CDT until May 05 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN OSAGE...CREEK...SOUTHEASTERN PAWNEE AND WEST CENTRAL TULSA COUNTIES... At 1150 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 2 miles south of Westport to 2 miles south of Depew, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Bristow... Mannford... Drumright... Oilton... Depew... Westport... Terlton... Shamrock... Keystone State Park... Walnut Creek State Park... Silver City... Milfay... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 178 and 204. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tulsa.
